thread.section_title: Latest business and finance news from New Zealand and the world's key markets - Yahoo New Zealand Finance
thread.title: Labor's first budget 'will keep promises'

title: Labor's first budget 'will keep promises'
text:
Fri, Jul 24, 2015, 1:34 PM NZST - New Zealand Markets close in 3 hrs 26 mins Labor's first budget 'will keep promises' AAP – 21 minutes ago Print 
A federal Labor government will keep its election promises in its first budget even if it means being unpopular, shadow treasurer Chris Bowen has pledged. 
"When I deliver Labor's first budget I want to be delivering a program on which we fought and won an election, for which we sought and won a mandate," he told delegates in a speech to the ALP national conference in Melbourne on Friday. 
"Now that will mean at times being controversial, sometimes being unpopular with some, but it also means leading the debate for a better, fairer and more sustainable policy on things like superannuation and making sure multinationals pay their fair share of tax." @YahooNZBusiness on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Most Aussies still keen on property market AAP 
Most Aussies still think it's a good time to get into the property market, despite house prices surging in Sydney …
